examples: "Comparisons are odious," said Jane, refusing to engage in a debate about which of her two friends was more successful.
So for comparison, most places in the U.S. have average PM2.5 levels below 10.
The physician and writer Lewis Thomas most famously made this comparison in 1973.
By comparison, avocados have much less sugar but more protein and fat.
By comparison, normal strains of the flu today have a mortality rate of around 0.1 percent.
words.defineEn: the process of examining the similarities and differences between two or more things or people
words.defineVi: quá trình kiểm tra sự tương đồng và khác biệt giữa hai hoặc nhiều thứ hoặc con người

examples: Who has a comparative advantage in cups?
They specialize in their comparative advantage.
In fact the entire collection can be used for comparative reasons.
She has a comparative advantage because her opportunity cost is lower.
Scientifically, Cuvier established modern comparative anatomy as a discipline, specializing in the study of elephants.
words.defineEn: relating to or based on or involving comparison
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc dựa trên hoặc liên quan đến so sánh

examples: Remuneration is in line with comparable international organizations.

words.defineEn: having a similar ground that justifies making a comparison
words.defineVi: có một nền tảng tương tự biện minh cho việc so sánh

examples: These three divergent devils are all based on Satan of the Old Testament, an angelic member of God’s court who torments Job in the Book of Job.

words.defineEn: marked by utter benignity; resembling or befitting an angel or saint

words.defineVi: một thiên thần được xếp hạng trên cấp bậc cao nhất trong hệ thống phân cấp thiên thể

words.defineEn: a young, innocent, and naive character, often a young woman, in a story or play

examples: Centuries ago, the Inca developed ingenuous suits of armor that could flex with the blows of sharp spears and maces, protecting warriors from even the fiercest physical attacks.
words.defineEn: showing simplicity, honesty, or innocence and willing to trust others due to a lack of life experience
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự đơn giản, trung thực hoặc ngây thơ và sẵn sàng tin tưởng người khác do thiếu kinh nghiệm sống

words.defineEn: thrust oneself in as if by force
words.defineVi: đẩy mình vào như thể bằng vũ lực

examples: You've got the fact that she had taken a lie detector test, and while that's not admissible in court, it certainly is admissible for establishing credibility when it comes to law enforcement and other things.

examples: That night the little creature did not stop crying and its pitiful little squeak tore at Aggie's heartstrings.

words.defineVi: không thương xót hay thương hại
